page.title: 11OTTER HOLE The Expeditions
page.content: The first expedition down Otter Hole was lead by George Gardener with David Parker.They only got as far the Eye Hole and then they lost the draught they were following.Another expedition was arranged ,this time lead by Phil Swarts.They also got as far as the Eye Hole.This happened a few times until once they almost lost their lives in the cave because of rising water. When they got out they noticed it was high tide in the River Wye. They realised that part of the caves were flooded at high tide. Expeditions were carefully planed from now.The next time they got past the Eye Hole and found the Hall of 30.Camp was made underground. It took 3 days to clear a boulder that blocked the passage. Once the passage was clear more chambers were found.Now the search began for other entrances to the system.
